headers.subject: [mule-user] Embedding Mule within Tomcat

body.para: I'm relatively new to Mule and I'm trying to run Mule 2.2.1 embedded within Tomcat 6.0.18.
As documented in the Mule users manual, I've configured my web.xml in WEB-INF with:
But when I start up Tomcat, I get the following class not found error:

SEVERE: Error configuring application listener of class org.mule.config.builders.MuleXmlBuilderContextListener java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: org.mule.config.builders.MuleXmlBuilderContextListener at org.apache.catalina.loader.WebappClassLoader.loadClass(WebappClassLoader.java:1387) at org.apache.catalina.loader.WebappClassLoader.loadClass(WebappClassLoader.java:1233) at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardContext.listenerStart(StandardContext.java:3786) at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardContext.start(StandardContext.java:4342) ...
Clearly the 'MuleXmlBuilderContextListener' class can't be found.

Should I resolve this by downloading and adding the 'mule-2.2.1-embedded.jar' into my web app, WEB-INF/lib? If I do this, the class is now found OK, but I also need to add many Spring and misc jars, etc.
Is the the correct way to embed Mule within Tomcat - or is this totally the wrong approach?
